TextView.android:text: Assumptions and Conclusions, Courses of Action

Assumptions and Conclusions : In these type of questions, we are given a conclusion and we have to find the most appropriate assumption from the given options. 

Courses of action : In these type of questions, we are given a scenario and a set of statements. We have to select a course of action that would be appropriate.

Directions to Solve 

In each question below is given a statement followed by two assumptions numbered I and II. You have to consider the statement and the following assumptions and decide which of the assumptions is implicit in the statement. 

Give answer 
(A) If only assumption I is implicit 
(B) If only assumption II is implicit 
(C) If either I or II is implicit 
(D) If neither I nor II is implicit 
(E) If both I and II are implicit.

Question 1: 

Statement: Anger is energy, in a more proactive way and how to channelise it is in itself a skill. 

Assumptions: 

Anger need to be channelized. 

Only skillful people can channelise anger to energy.


(1) If only assumption I is implicit. 
(2) If only assumption II is implicit. 
(3) if either I or II is implicit. 
(4) if neither I or II is implicit. 
(5) if both I and II are implicit.

Question 2: 

Statement: Medicine ‘x’ is a drug which is causing ripples in the medical field. 

Assumptions: 

No other drug is causing ripples in the medical field. 

Medicine ‘x’ is a great drug.


(1) If only assumption I is implicit. 

(2) If only assumption II is implicit. 

(3) if either I or II is implicit. 

(4) if neither I or II is implicit 

(5) if both I and II are implicit.

Question 3: 

Statement: The ticket for Balcony class is atrociously priced at Rs. 200. 

Assumptions: 

The tickets for other classes are decently priced. 

Rs 200 is a very big amount to pay for a balcony ticket.


(1) If only assumption I is implicit. 

(2) If only assumption II is implicit. 

(3) if either I or II is implicit. 

(4) if neither I or II is implicit. 

(5) if both I and II are implicit.

Question 4: 

Statement: 'You are hereby appointed as a programmer with a probation period of one year and your performance will be reviewed at the end of the period for confirmation.' - A line in an appointment letter. 

Assumptions: 

The performance of an individual generally is not known at the time of appointment offer. 

Generally an individual tries to prove his worth in the probation period. 

A. Only assumption I is implicit 

B. Only assumption II is implicit 

C. Either I or II is implicit 

D. Neither I nor II is implicit 

E. Both I and II are implicit

Question 5: 

Statement: It is desirable to put the child in school at the age of 5 or so. 

Assumptions: 

At that age the child reaches appropriate level of development and is ready to learn. 

The schools do not admit children after six years of age. 

A. Only assumption I is implicit 

B. Only assumption II is implicit 

C. Either I or II is implicit 

D. Neither I nor II is implicit 

E. Both I and II are implicit

Question 6:

Assumptions: 

Conveyance allowance will not help in bringing punctuality. 

Discipline and reward should always go hand in hand. 

A. Only assumption I is implicit 

B. Only assumption II is implicit 

C. Either I or II is implicit

E. Both I and II are implicit

Question 7: 

Statement: Unemployment allowance should be given to all unemployed Indian youth above 18 years of age. 

Assumptions: 

There are unemployed youth in India who needs monetary support. 

The government has sufficient funds to provide allowance to all unemployed youth.
